alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Grant; Hooker; Logan; McPherson; Thomas; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 8:06PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Arthur, southwestern Cherry, Grant, Hooker, northwestern Logan, northern McPherson and western Thomas Counties through 845 PM CDT/745 PM MDT/... At 806 PM CDT/706 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Seneca to 8 miles northeast of Ashby. Movement was south at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mullen, Arthur, Hyannis, Seneca, Swan Lake, Whitman, Speckel Meir Lake, Duluth, Dipping Vat Meadow, Cogill Lake, Intersection of Highway 61 and Survey Valley Road, Marsh Flat, Green Lake, Whitman Road crossing the North Branch of the Middle Loup River, Three Mile Lake, Pratt Lake, Sevenmile Hill, Kelso, Shimmons Lake and Carr Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 139 and 203. Highway 61 between mile markers 123 and 183. Highway 92 between mile markers 165 and 181. Highway 97 between mile markers 34 and 89. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Arthur; Grant; Hooker; Logan; McPherson; Thomas; Western Cherry
